UNCW Upperman African American Cultural Center
May 8 at 4:04 PM ¬∑

Inspired by the third principle of Kwanzaa,, recognizing the principle of collective work and responsibility, the Ujima Community Partnership Award recognizes esteemed community partners who assist the Upperman African American Cultural Center in our mission to develop well-rounded, comprehensive activist scholar-leaders.

Recipients of the Ujima Community Partnership award are tireless advocates for the UNCW Black Community and the university, selflessly offering their time, talents and expertise for the sake of creating a thriving community for black students on our campus. Recipients of this award have a long standard record of partnership with UNCW, the Upperman Center and the African American student body on campus.

Sabrina is recognized for her committment to helping to connect primary education students to college students of color.
